Reviews.Title: “Valet Parking mixed up keys & tags & tried to give me someone else's vehicle.”
Reviews.Author: Missbhavn
Reviews.Content: Despite checking in at 7pm on a Sunday the check- in line was quite long with just one person working the counter. My room appeared to be cleaned in a hurry & was even missing facecloths. Rooms were okay, but could use a little extra soundproofing. The valet parking is a bit of a rip-off at $26 a night. To make matters worse when I handed in my tag to retrieve my vehicle one morning I was accused of having taking someone else's tag. The error was not mine but the valet who mixed them up. I was very unhappy that someone else may of been able to access my new SUV. The next morning when I tried to get my SUV I found it parked jammed under a pipe on the ceiling that was squishing my antenna. If you take the parking issues out of the picture the hotel was average.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 777Guest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the weekend. I encountered several problems that the hotel manager made no attempt at fixing or correcting. To make matters worse, I got several bed bug bites on my arms and face!! Bed bug bites can appear up to 7 days later ... mine appeared 3 days later. Although this hotel looks impressive and upper class, it is actually FILTHY!! Do not waste your money on this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Made my trip 100 times better”
Reviews.Author: Ashley B
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get this hotel through hotwire and it was awesome. My recent trip to Montreal started rather bad but due to the amazing rooms in this hotel, the awesome service nd great location I managed to enjoy myself. It is close to the Montreal Eaton Center, St. Catherine St. , Bars and museums. As well there is a metro just down the street. My only complaints were more so that I would have liked a balcony and I did not have a fridge in my room so I had to get ice (which can be found on even levels). Besides that my bed was comfortable, no noise and a nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Guest beware!”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a larger group. During the room requisitions, we specifically requested that we did not want adjoining rooms. When we arrived at the hotel, we realized that all our rooms were adjoining even though our request was clearly stated that on our sheet. They told us that it must have been an error with the reservation department, but nothing was done to fix it. On our first night, in inspecting the mattress, we found a suspicious bag in one of the rooms. With further inspection and from the smell on opening, it appeared to be marijuana. In approaching the desk with it the next morning, we were greeted with a response that insinuated that someone in our group had brought it. This is was infuriating! During my second night, before I was about to get into bed, I noticed a black bug crawly on my bed sheet. I briefly examined the mattress and since I couldn't visually see anything, and it didn't look like a bedbug, I decided that it may have been a single bug that had come in on my shoe, or something. The next morning, I saw another bug crawling out from under my sheet. I was disgusted at this point thinking of how many more there might have been. Since it had been our last night, I simply informed the front desk and they said they would let housekeeping know. When packing, I looked underneath the bed to make sure I hadn't left anything behind. In doing so, I found an old used cup, an article of clothing (not mine), and wrappers. Overall, I would NEVER stay at this hotel again! The amount of cleanliness issues that we encountered was disgusting. The front desk seemed to brush everything off as being no big deal, and on top of that insinuated that we had brought drugs! That is completely unacceptable, unprofessional and terrible way to treat a paying customer!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay full price!”
Reviews.Author: Daizie45
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in early March. It was a last minute trip to Montreal, and we booked our room through Hotwire. We are glad we did because paying $61 for this room (without taxes) was better than the $125 as advertised on the Holiday Inn website. That being said, our room was actually very clean. I was expecting worse after reading previous reviews of this place. The bed was comfy, tv worked, and wifi was strong. The bathrooms are very tiny. Although the hotel is a bit worn, it was worth the Hotwire price. The location is excellent as it is near the Metro, St. Catherine's Street and a short walk to Crescent Street. An entrance to the underground mall is also close by. Parking was $25 (valet only), but we thought it was worth it knowing that our car was safe. This hotel seems like a party hotel for anyone attending bachelor/bachelorette parties, hockey games, or US college kids. We even witnessed a fight where a guy was punched in his nose and was bleeding EVERYWHERE. Overall a good stay for a good price. If you do book on a third party site, they will not give you breakfast vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at a convenient location, close to it all.”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown Montreal. It was convenient to transportation, shopping, entertainment and dining. My stay was most enjoyable in a great room overlooking the city and in the distance, the Jacque Cartier Bridge and the distant mountains. Staff was courteous and attentive to detail, from Concierge to front desk and reception. All details of the stay were looked after. I look forward to my next trip to Montreal and staying at the Holiday Inn. Alan B

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Peter123412
Reviews.Content: I attended a wedding at the Holiday Inn and was pleasantly surprised on the accommodations, service and the abundance of quality food being served on the big day. Being of italian descent and finding the Italian dishes served to be above par, came as an unexpected pleasure. Coupled with the pleasantries shared with staff and the all-round accommodations, I surely would recommend a stay and or a wedding at the Holiday Inn Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “University Trip to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: m_tee010
Reviews.Content: The lobby is gorgeous, too bad when you go upstairs it isn't much better. i was there in October during a mandatory research trip with my university. We had 2 bed suites with a washroom, nothing more. Washrooms were tiny as well (and dirty), the sink was actually across the hall. being on a floor full on university students wasn't the greatest thing either, actually the walls seem to be paper thin I could hear every little conversation in the hall. We had continental breakfast vouchers for the restaurant downstairs, which was good for coffee or tea, orange juice, cereal and milk and a croissant. Other than that, location was good. Close to mcgill and a couple blocks down from rue st. catharine. provigo down the street for booze ;) Stayed at the W two months later....what a difference

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn - Requires Renovation - Dirty”
Reviews.Author: JAMAICANToronto
Reviews.Content: Carpet and mirrors were dirty; we checked the carpet and dust bunnies and a paper wrapper remained for 3 days. Bathroom tap leaking; bathroom door not working properly;bath tub was dirty Paint peeling all around There were no hand towels or wash cloths in the room; had to call for them Thermostat was broken in the room - either extremely hot or cold Recommend you try another hotel. My husband travels frequently to Montreal on business and he would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but lacking Holiday Inn experience!”
Reviews.Author: mw_dewit
Reviews.Content: I booked the room months in advance, booking a room on the corporate floor with breakfast included. The location of the hotel is great. The swimming pool was very nice, and the hotel has a good gym facilities but the jacuzzi had hair and nails in. There is a sauna and wet steam room in the change areas. Complimentary WiFi is great to have, but slow. The hotel have a very odd voucher system for breakfast. I received 5 breakfast vouchers - one per night for me and my partner. On the first morning, we were advised that the coupon is for continental breakfast , and that a coupon is for one person only. I indicated that I had booked a room for two people. The waiter only shrugged his shoulders and said that I need to sort it out with the hotel. (Afterwards I realised that the restaurant is run and managed separately from the hotel.) Continental breakfast is very poor and wouldn't fill a child, let alone an adult, consists of coffee/tea and juice and 2 of a small selection of choices. ie croissant; pain au chocolat; oatmeal toast and one or two other goods. I had to leave my partner; go to the room - on the 15th floor to get the booking confirmation - to sort the voucher issue. The receptionist was quick to sort out the 'error' and gave new breakfast vouchers to the value of $20 per day for 2 people or $10 for one. (Breakfast prices start from $9.45 excl all the taxes up to $18+) Any expense more than $20 had to be paid by ourselves. I was a bit surprised and annoyed that nowhere on the web-site or confirmation does it indicate that breakfast vouchers are issued and that any excess has to be paid for. I have never encountered this odd system when staying with Holiday Inn before! The standard of breakfast was not worth it. We paid a tip/gratitude every morning - about 15%. On the last day the waiter entered her own tip, which I thought was exceedingly rude! On the second day I mentioned that I was a Holiday Inn Premier Club Elite member, and was given an upgrade. I thought that, as the hotel was virtually empty, they would have done so without being prompted. The man who sorted it did it in a very professional manner, but feel it should been allocated automatic at the time of check in During the stay I developed a skin rash - not sure if it was from the jacuzzi, but a local pharmacist was able to give me medication to treat it. Other reviews have mentioned bedbugs. On the morning of our departure a hotel cleaner, who left her trolley outside our room, was quick to ask what time we were checking out. I would have thought, as an employee, she would have known what time check out time in the hotel is... The whole hotel is in desperate need of a refurbishment!

Reviews.Title: “What great surprise !!”
Reviews.Author: Dealguru
Reviews.Content: I walked into an urban oasis!!! What an amazing lobby-I felt like like I was a resort!!Long long away from the hustle and bustle of downtown (just outside) I saved a fortune in taxis!! Best restaurants ,theatres,museums ,old Montreal -minutes away!I was so surprised! Last trip to a major city I went to I spent more on taxis than my entire trip! -not here-Flat screen,HD tvs,modern rooms everything one could want!Ralph,the manager was amazing-he knew when,where and how to go to the "right" places and even called ahead-so I wouldn't have to wait-thanks again!see you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation!!!”
Reviews.Author: V P
Reviews.Content: I was horrified when our group picked this hotel for their stay after reading the reviews. Most of what I read was true. Though, no bed bugs, I took apart each bed and the mattresses were like new. Needs new doors, new carpeting throughout and new bathrooms desperately! There was mold in the grout. Doors to hall are paper thin, we were whispering everything because there was zero privacy with regards to sound. They were not very accommodating when we asked for an upgraded room - not sure if it was due to the "package" our team was locked into. Parking was $25/day. Housekeeping was very friendly and quick to bring extra towels. It was a very active hotel with weddings and parties going on both Fri and Sat nights. I was a good sport and stuck it out, but when spending $750 for 3 nights, one would expect better accommodations. I would not recommend this hotel to friends or strangers, nor stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but some flaws.”
Reviews.Author: Gavin L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks on business. As a priority club platinum member I got no upgrade but did get access to a mediocre lounge on the 18th floor. Not much to get excited about here though. A TV, PC with internet access and muffins etc in the morning were offered. It was close to the metro and Rue Ste Catherine, but a little far from the party streets if that's what you're looking for. The hotel has a nice pool, jacuzzi and sauna. Gym was pretty good also. The staff were pleasant overall but during my stay I tried to extend reservation and was told they would call me back in my room to confirm availability but they never did. I had to call back twice more to eventualy do it. Housekeeping seemed to be quite half assed with the exception of a couple of days when my room was cleaned to an acceptable standard. Overal, the cleaniness of rooms was questionable. Had to get my key reprogrammed 3 times in 2 weeks which was also quite inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the savings”
Reviews.Author: Diane L
Reviews.Content: I've made the Holiday my choice place to stay when I travel to Montreal every fall. I just returned from a 3 day trip and can firmly say that I will not be returning to this hotel. Compared to 8 years ago, the quality and service have seriously deteriorated. The rooms are filthy and unattended and the hotel is in a state of needing significant repairs and updates. I ended up changing rooms 3 times during my short stay due to problems ranging from a television that didn't work to a broken thermostat that left the room in a sauna state. In addition to this, this hotel regularly books numerous hockey teams so expect loud, latenight parties and out of control rowdy athletes who are inconsiderate of other patrons who are trying to sleep. I had to call the front desk to request that security deal with the noise. The cleaning staff 'looked' busy with their service carts and vaccum hoses in the hallways, however, not once did I hear the vaccum being used and the chambermaids were very quick to make the beds - and that's where it stops. Although the price was competitive, the state of this hotel was not worth it. I will spend the extra money and stay elsewhere knowing that there are higher hotel quality standards and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: upshot1
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights for work, and the stay was pleasant- can comment on any of the services since I did not use any. It was in a very nice area and was also within walking distance to several good restaurants. The room was clean, and the wifi worked without any issue. One minor complaint was that the curtains does not close at all. It was more for decoration that anything else. This hotel would have gotten 4 stars had it not for the curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy hotel”
Reviews.Author: einarlie
Reviews.Content: Never in my life stayed in a more filthy and smelly hotel and that in the otherwise friendly and clean Montreal. Avoid at any cost! Hotel assigned by Air Canada due to flight cancellation.

Reviews.Title: “Very entertaining”
Reviews.Author: nouran43
Reviews.Content: We arrived Montreal 8/28 for 10 days visit , coming from a very far place (Egypt) we wanted a nice hotel with good location and luckily the Holiday inn was the one .it is close to crescent street , the Plato and 20 min. Walk to old town and the harbor . Holiday inn downtown Montreal is a big hotel so if you are looking for relaxation it is not a good choice but it is full of life ,very entertaining ,at weekends you can see, at least,three weddings every night,they have a very good restaurant , do n't miss it ,the swimming pool is great ,we enjoyed it very much .Though it is a huge property the stuff are very friendly and helpful,our room was large and clean ,the only negative thing happened,when we asked for a wake up call in our last night they did n't make it ,and thanks God we could hardly catch our plane.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal,great location”
Reviews.Author: Randymatl
Reviews.Content: For the price you can't beat this location.you can walk anywhere and the food in the restaurant and the coffee bar was great and reasonable.best deal in downtown Montreal

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT CHOOSE HOLIDAY INN MIDTOWN IN MONTREAL, CANADA. IT HAS BED BUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: angel c
Reviews.Content: It was 3 in the morning and my girlfriend woke me up saying that there was something weird in the matress... I woke up and watched a bunch of red little bed bugs walking over there and we were all covered with rashes: neck, arms, legs, everywhere!! We called to the reception and a guy went up to our room and checked the situation and give us another room; we had to carry all our luggage at 3 in the morning only to discover that in the other room was a big spot in the bathroom, what a shameful situation to the reputation of this hotel. They changed us (again!!) to one of the suites but it was pitifully very very common. The next day we talk to the manager Peter Megalos and he explained us that bed bugs were a plague there but they would refound us our money...it never happened. Please do not ruin your vacations...do not choose holiday inn midtown in montreal, canada.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great, and a little far away”
Reviews.Author: phillipsrhit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok for the right price. We booked late and while not that close to downtown, it was a decent rate. Only a few blocks from the subway to quickly get downtown. There was a large party on our floor one night, so we asked and they moved us up to a higher, more quiet floor (and a larger room). The indoor heated pool was nice to take our 3 year old to a couple times. Next time I would probably stay closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to ask for a non-smoking room!”
Reviews.Author: RenataOttawa
Reviews.Content: When I walked down the hall to my room I thought the hall way smelled a bit musty but when I started to set up my lap top to my surprise I had to move an ashtray! I had been given a smoking room without being asked - since when is that the default!! I called to request a different room and was told the hotel was full (although I could change at 8AM which was when I had to leave for business). Other management problems here: when I called to order an in room breakfast they did not have the menu so I had to explain what was available also had to get hangers from the cleaning staff. Main street side room a bit noisy but a nicely proportioned room so despite the smell I survived and the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel I ever been”
Reviews.Author: LBoutin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at that Hotel , from September 26 to September 30th ( 4 nights) , When I made my reservation(Priority Ambassador member), I request for an Executive bedroom, 2 double bed , with work desk, etc. , so I can do business in the room (I was there to work and meet people). When I got to the room, I taught it was a mistake, no working desk, no fridge, I called the front desk and asked, they simply said that the kind of room that I want , is only offered on the smoking floor ???? excuse me!!! Then I started to look around, and all I was seeing was Dust and more dust, dirty carpet, even blood on the bathroom wall and on the lamp-shades. First morning, I looked at the door to pick-up my news paper..no news paper (I am here to work and I depend on the news paper for the job I have to do ), I call back at the front desk, the answer was ...you will have to come down and pick one up and it's 1$ ...say what? it's part of my membership to get free news paper at the door (Free) every morning... 10 minutes after that the bell boy was at the door with a news paper (but that was the only one I got during my stay) . For the room being cleaned everyday....forget it, if you happen to be in your bedroom when the cleaning lady knocks on your door , she will say goodbye and will never return ( my room was not cleaned ( news towels, make the bed , etc) for 2 days, for what it's called cleaning, because when I left it was as dusty as it was when I came in (except for where I put my fingers) It was the first time at that hotel and believe me, it will be the last , Usually I was going to Intercontinental and I will continue with them , I got my lesson!!!! The restaurant: the food was good , but the waiters are too fast or totally absent ( I had to go to the bar twice and ask if I have to place my order there, because no one showed up at my table) My recommendation : Stay away from that place!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Montreal midtown”
Reviews.Author: pamela w
Reviews.Content: Booked this room last minute for a spur of the moment trip. Check in was super efficient although they had no discount for Priority Club which is the ONLY reason we would normally stay at Holiday Inn, I did get buy 1 get 1 drinks for the bar for being priority club but as I was travelling with a toddler they were useless, valet was great (but pricey at $25) and the lobby with the shops and resturants was nice. But it all went down hill from there! The room was a standard non renovated room # 329 overlooking the roof next door, the bed was so worn out that the foot was a good 3 inches higher than the head, the wallpaper was peeling, the tv remote was maddening (I think the batteries are dying), there are mysterious stains on the wall above the tv and the vacuuming/sweeping was not great! Overall the location was GREAT but I would say the room not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JLFLOVESFOOD
Reviews.Content: Will be traveling again soon, but have stayed a couple of times at the hotel. Rooms are very nice, sometimes you can hear hair dryers going in the next room, but otherwise haven't had any problems. Everyone is very nice, love the hotel restaurant. It is convenient to the Metro where you can access any part of town, or walk to the underground where there is a wide variety of shops. Again never had a bad experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Pat P
Reviews.Content: Business traveler and Holiday Inn Platium member. Internet access poor finally moved rooms after complaining, Outdated and small rooms that noisy from thin walls/doors. Front desk was very slow to respond and spent a great deal of time waiting for assistance.

Reviews.Title: “noisy teen party hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billie203
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with my 2 daughters, 12 and 14. The first 2 nights were fine. The 3rd night there was a graduation party. They were actually partying in the hallways! I called several times. Nothing helped. They finally moved me and my kids at midnight. They couldn't control these obnoxious kids. The obnoxious kids even made comments as my children and I had our bags moved to a different location. They moved several other rooms of customers too. I can't believe they actually moved several rooms of paying customers instead of getting rid of the partying kids. It would of been bad if the noise was coming from the rooms, but the party was also going on in my hallway. When we were being moved the 2 elevators opened at the same time. Both were filled with more teenagers going to the party.I asked for my money back for just that night. The hotel chain gave me back $42.00. The hotel itself promised me a coupon for 2 free nights which I never recieved. If you look through the comments about this hotel, you will see this is an ongoing problem. I saw this in the reviews before I went to the hotel and figured it was just some bitter people complaining about a little noise and ignored it. Was I in for a big shock!

Reviews.Title: “I've had better”
Reviews.Author: SSunShineGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in here for my Best Friend's Wedding. the rooms: our carpets looked like they were blood stained. Bathtubs didn't drain, walls were paper thin, and i wasn't able to locate the ice bin or at least one that had ice in it. Staff: very rude and un accomadation, i babysat the brides dog for an hour and had to pay a 35$ fee even though she had already done so. They have since made and effort to make ammends. wedding: reception room had NO AC....it was soo hot we all had to have our makeup re - done. i mean it was by no means unbarable...but i would most likly stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Paolo182002
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a bachelor party. Walk in and the lobby is beautiful. They clearly put alot of money into the lobby. The rooms on the other hand awful! Rooms are so small it's ridiculous. Bathrooms are the most disgusting bathroom I've ever seen. Mold all over the walls. Outdated puke green tiling. Showerhead that barely worked and no hot water! Do not go to this place. Many other hotels in Montreal at this price that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: CarnboConfidential
Reviews.Content: Where to start... Arrived after a 7.5 hour flight and a 1 hour transfer from airport at around 3pm. Sorry but your room isn't ready. Went for a coffee, which we had to pay for as it was a franchise. Two hours later we got into our room. Dirty, old fashioned (1970's) with wiring faling out of the wall. Complain to (unhelpful reception) and a "handyman" turns up nearly an hour later, makes perfunctory repairs and suggests that our needs are excessive. Tell that to my 4 & 6 year old nephews who found wiring and half eaten sweets/candy on the floor. This is only a part review which I shall return to soon and add some photographic evidence. Really dislike writing a bad review as I try to see good in every hotel. sorry to say that I cannot for this one. Will also add a review (positive) of the Delta Quebec ASAP

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Doffa
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and since we got an up-grade to the executive floor we really liked our room and especially the very good beds where we had a very restful sleep. The service and reception people were friendly and professional. The in-house restaurant on the ground floor was so good that we ate there two times. The location of the hotel is okay but for the historic part of town you have to walk about 15 min which is okay when the weather plays along. Overall a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 1 night on our way to Toronto. The location is not bad but not the best. Our room was fine. Upon arriving at our room we noticed that the Iron in the room was broken; we asked the staff to change it for us. and left the hotel for a few hours. when we got back it was still not changed! we called again and asked them to do it as we were going to bed and were supposed to leave in he morning, we needed to iron our clothes! after another 2 hours of wait there was no Iron coming up! we went to sleep. I had to go down to the reception at 5 am and ask them to hand me the iron then and there as I would not have time to wait any longer! they arranged it and finally we got the iron by 5.30 am. left the hotel at 6.30 am. other than this we didn't faceany problems and I could still say this hotel is fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJD19
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly with directions and sites to see. The rooms were very clean and the location was good. We were here for a bachelor party, so the connecting rooms were great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CracowDanang
Reviews.Content: Very good, centrally located city hotel within walking distance to many things. Great choice for business trip in Montreal. The hotel is busy; it's a large property with many guest, so the service was not always very fast but still nice and professional. The hotel has a restaurant, a bar, a coffee shop (also with some food), a good size swimming pool and a nice equipped gym. The room was big enough, comfortably furnished but there is no free Wifi in the room (only available for payment). The bath was very clean. A continental breakfast was included in the room price and it was tasty. Everything worked good here so I can recommend this hotel for city stays in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Three and a half star hotel”
Reviews.Author: whisus
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband booked this hotel online through a discount site and were pleased that it turned out to be the Holiday Inn. That didn't last, however, when we arrived. The room we were given was obviously equipped for someone with a handicap (hand bars, raised toilet) which wasn't a problem but the room appeared dated, the carpet torn, etc. I woke up the next day with red welts on my legs and body ? bites. I had to blow the dust off the phone when I used it to call the manager, The manager was very quick to give us another room. Also we weren't asked on check in if we wanted a smoking or non smoking floor. The smell of smoke was overpowering on the second floor. We were moved to the ninth floor which was much better but the noise was ridiculous at 3 AM in the morning. We were in Montreal for a medical reason, so complaining about the hotel was the furthest thing from my mind, hence, this review. I wouldn't stay at this hotel a second time.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: outlier0901
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Montreal Midtown for a family vacation. The hotel is conveniently located, just a short walk away from the Subway. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The restaurant had a good selection, and the price was reasonable. The cafe at the lobby served good coffee at a reasonable price. The parking is quite expensive, so do look around for cheaper options.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very friendly employees.”
Reviews.Author: Rudy_Joy
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and had a great time. The hotel is within walking distance of a number of attractions. The bartender, Vanessa, was delightful and very helpful in recommending places to visit and good restaurants for meals. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: F1Q
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel off and on for the last 4 years when in Montreal. Location is good if you want to be near downtown and has parking for large cars (many Montreal hotels underground garages can not take cars over 6 feet). Large indoor pool. Older hotel but the rooms and lobby have been renovated. Staff is friendly and helpful. The one complaint is the noise. The walls seem very thin and you can hear noises in the hall at night (can hear conversations as people walk buy your room). Also can hear the toilets in the rooms next door to you clearly.

Reviews.Title: “not a 3 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: wcjm
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is its location. If that is most important to you, you might be willing to overlook the peeling wallpaper, dirty and stained carpets, and the bathtub that leaves you standing ankle deep in water after a brief shower. The hotel is in dire need of a renovation, and We thought the 3 1/2 star rating was inaccurate and should be 2 at most. The gym was ok, the pool was cloudy and uninviting. The service is inconsistent. We called the front desk to ask for toothpaste, since we'd forgotten ours, at 11pm. They said they would send some right up, but it didn't arrive and at midnight we went to bed. When we called again in the morning, they did send it up promptly. The valet parking was $24 a night, and we didn't have to wait long for them to bring our car upon departure. Overall we did not have a terrible experience- but I would stay elsewhere next time. The room was just too shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Hard in trying circumstances”
Reviews.Author: Terryl-55
Reviews.Content: Context English speaking Business Traveler who is relatively culturally sensitive and is a PC Platinum member. I use this hotel because it is an IHG property close to my clients and no other reason. Review. This is a slightly dated property that needs a major refurb, having said that it is clean, tidy and professionally run. The rooms are OK not great. The bathroom layout is really dated. Once you see it you will know what I mean. My major criteria for room comfort is this. Can I leave the AC on at night and still sleep and the answer here is YES - just. The Restaurant and the Coffee vendor in the lobby are both Concessions and as such independent businesses, that mean no consistency in service and it shows. The Coffee Vendor is solid gold and deserve accolades. The Restaurant is marginal, the attached bar is better thanks to his great staff. This is the hotel's business model and that is their choice but it detracts from the overall rating of the hotel. The whole French thing is a problem. This is downtown Montreal and us Anglophones can't help but think we are being despised by the Front Desk staff. I am not sure they even realize it is happening but........ guess what!!!! I am not Canadian, I am not British, I had nothing to do with the Plains of Abraham so don't take it our on me OK. There is a definite attitude problem from the obvious Francophones and considering the number of US, Australian and other English speakers this is a major issue as at the end of the day these people are in the service industry. If they can't deal with that change jobs. I will stay at this hotel again, as it is close to my clients, well located, clean and well run, it just misses the mark on all the intangibles that make a difference. Oh and Breakfast is in need of attention, I have been quoted as saying that my worst meal in Montreal is better than my best meal in the USA. Breakfast at this hotel is an exception. This hotel's Breakfast struggles to meet the Denny's standard. For hat is delivered this is an expensive hotel. the same facilities and location in the US would be a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, walls paper thin, phone broken”
Reviews.Author: MaryG_from_Toronto
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean, friendly staff, bed comfy, location close to St.Catherine Street, McGill University and Musee Des Beaux Arts. There's a Metro/Subway station down the street. Cons: The phone in our room was broken so we missed an important message. Front desk staff said they tried to call us 3x but we were in the room for 2 hours and the phone never rang. The blinking light to indicate voicemail didn't start flashing until we came back hours later and had already missed the important message. Tried to delete the message but the phone said I had none. We didn't get a good nights sleep one night because the walls are thin and we could hear the teenage dance party next door. We didn't call the front desk because we didn't want to change rooms in the midle of the night so I don't know how they would've responded. If the room next to yours opens the water, you will definitely hear it. Loud pipes. Bathtub took a long time to drain. Very dim lighting. We had a fancy event to go to and could not put on makeup properly even with every light on and all blinds open. There was no fridge in the room, and no fan in the bathroom. . Bottom line, if you want something simple and clean, and reasonably close to major attractions, this is fine. If you're looking for something reasonably comfortable, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Will probably look to upgrade or change hotels next time”
Reviews.Author: gabcom25
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our stay at this hotel for a few reasons. We were looking for a hotel central to old Montreal and downtown, it was pretty much the only plus for us. No fridge in room, old TV, noisy plumbing,pushy cleaning staff, lack of help from front desk...Our friends stayed on another floor, few dollars more a night(6$) and they lucked into executive floor because of smoking, had we known.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location, small bathrooms and toilet facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Answerman543
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. The price was reasonable, the location was superb (Just for Laughs/St Catherine Street). Facilities are fine, and the room was comfortable, clean and quiete, except for a couple of bufoons in the hall one night (Not the hotel's fault). Negatives: Small bathroom and toilet areas (separated). Valet parking only and expensive. They could upgrade to newer flat screen TV's. Front desk staff was helpful and efficient. Overall - I'd definitely stay here again, but I might find other parking arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel desperately needs a renovation.”
Reviews.Author: tourist_travails
Reviews.Content: My husband is a business traveller and stays at Holiday Inn hotels...as a result he has accumulated a whole lot of Priority club points. We decided to redeem some of these for the Holiday Inn Montreal. The location of this hotel was the only good thing going for this property. This hotel is in serious need of repair and renovation. The bathroom was the worst we've come across...needed a makeover. The coffee maker was dirty...had to call for a new one. The mattresses were some old spring mattress type...very uncomfortable. No refrigerator in the room. We booked it inspite of the negative reviews since we assumed some standard for a holiday Inn...but all the negative reviews about this hotel were correct so lesson learnt is pay attention to reviews.

Reviews.Title: “2 Days in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: amarot
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and comfortable bed, good price for room! The pool area needs updating! Wi Fi was not functioning on the upper levels of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again - even if the cost was only $5 per night.”
Reviews.Author: Liket0travelal0t
Reviews.Content: With two children who are teenagers who play competitive sports, we have stayed in ALOT of hotels across Ontario, Michigan and Quebec. I have never been so disgusted with a hotel. The dirty dishes on floor 7 remained there for 3 days after we checked in. The maids watched TV for hours (we saw this twice over our stay) instead of cleaning. The bathtub didn't drain. The water only ran hot or cold - no warm. It cost $24 per night to park and it took up to 20 minutes to get our car from the valet (who needs a valet?). The carpet was dirty. There was no wireless on Floor 7. When I called the front desk they connected me to Datavalet and expected me to trouble shoot it with them. After 4 days and 11 inquiries, it still doesn't work. 2 towels and no facecloths per room. No air temp control - they control it. Staff at the front desk don't care. No fridge as requested. When they brought it up, I thought it looked like it was 20 years old. The table in the room is broken. Disgusting, dirty, run down and poorly run. DON'T STAY HERE - THERE ARE MANY HOTELS THAT ARE MUCH BETTER. AT $150 IT IS ROBBERY. At $100 it is not worth it. At $5 I still wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VIVAHUME
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn on a quick weekend business trip and found it to be a well located hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. The hotel includes all of the amenities that you can expect from a Holiday inn - pool, fitness center, hot tub, business center, wifi in the rooms. Looks to be well maintained. The room was clean (view of the building beside), shower was hot, bed was comfortable. Minor stuff - No fridge in the room, elevator is slow and busy. The hotel is located in downtown Montreal and is in a great central location for a bit of sight seeing on your downtime. It's a bit of a walk to old Montreal (10-15min), but very manageable. It is close the St. Catherine St and the underground city system where you can get all of your shopping in. One minor note - I booked online and was quoted one price, but when I checked out, they charged me a higher rate. Be sure to present your online reservation or compare the two prices before leaving. $35 Flat fee for a cab from the airport. All in all, no complaints, I'd gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER AGAIN - WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER”
Reviews.Author: egaquaman
Reviews.Content: Ok, bad hotel guests can happen. How people behave is sometimes out of the hotel's control. In this case though there was a large party happening on my floor until all hours. I did not sleep at all. The front desk was called a few times, they did not care! In the morning, I explained that I did not sleep at all and could not function at a business presentation that I had to give. The front desk clerk did not care! Did not offer ANY kind of apology or anything. I wrote a letter to holiday inn head office (twice)! The first complaint I received a form letter back saying they take matters seriously and that the hotel management was contacted. One month went by with no follow up so I wrote again. Now I got a different form letter! Basically this one stated thank you for voicing your concerns again, the hotel management has been notified. What I read between the lines was "Thank you for writing. We really don't care what you say and could care less about your business". As both my wife and I are regular business AND vacation travellers, we have taken Holiday Inn off of our corporate travel plans and will no longer authorize ANY expenses from this hotel for our staffs. Not because of one poor experience (that can happen), but because of the ambivalence in dealing with our situation. Do yourself a favour. Go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Ziolko
Reviews.Content: very good localisation, staff supportive, rooms are fine. Nothing very special but no flaws or problems

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms, Great Food and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: cincil
Reviews.Content: We have attended the formula 1 grand prix weekend for 16 years and it has always been comforting to know that we can rely on the Holiday Inn and their staff to make it a perfect weekend. The location of the hotel is ideal for all events, the rooms are spacious and clean with all the ammenities. The luxurious bed pillows create a sound and restful sleep. The food in the resturaunt is good quality and the service is always excellent. Finally the staff and management have always taken care of all our needs and make us feel at home. We will continue to attend the grand prix and the Holiday Inn will be our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for work and play”
Reviews.Author: leisenbeis
Reviews.Content: I had stayed previously for work and found the location and amenities to be perfect. On my recent stay, I arrived early to enjoy the city before work meetings. The location is quite good for the plateau, old Montreal, McGill area and general downtown. Very walkable distances to all. Staff were very helpful with inquiries. Room was basic, clean although the bathroom could benefit from a fan for humidity. Hotel restaurant is quite adequate for breakfast and quick meals. There is also a 'coffee bar' in the lobby which does excellent lattes and serves gelato! Business centre has 4 computers and 2 printers. Would stay again for work or personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Brilliant Value”
Reviews.Author: will6647
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Sherbrooke for 8 weeks, and I can honestly say it was a fantastic hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are cleaned spotlessely every day, and the gym and pool facilities are excellent. The bar and restaurant are also good quality. Overall a good experience and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: screaminghawks1
Reviews.Content: i was staying in room 302, me and my roommates got in, no towels, no toilet paper, no shampoo, walls weren't soundproofed, beds weren't made, when room service was called, it took 30 minutes to come, nothing was folded (not sure if they were cleaned before we came)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: shlomitaviva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend in June with my mother-in-law. Overall excellent experience. Some confusion with valet parking and getting luggage to room but after that everything went smoothly!! My husband and I enjoyed the saltwater pool and hottub and my 81 year old mother-in-law loved walking in the neighbourhood around the hotel as well as hanging out in the beautiful lobby or the VLTs!!!! Our room was spacious and everything worked. The rooms are a little dated but definitely clean and in good working order. A great value!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, close to McGill and in the heart of Rue St. Laurant & Rue St. Denis”
Reviews.Author: cupedoll
Reviews.Content: Very nice Holiday Inn on busy Sherbrooke Street, in the heart of downtown Montreal. Walking distance to all the sites. Metro (both by bus and subway) access nearby. I've been to Montreal on several occasions both for business and pleasure but this was the first time I decided to take the bus from the airport to the first subway stop to get on to bring me downtown close to my hotel. Although I still had to walk about 3 blocks from the Palais (sp?) des Arts it was easy to understand the directions that were given to me. For just $8 fare from the airport to downtown Montreal, it was very easy and I will most definitely do it again. The Holiday Inn was wonderful. The staff were great. Rooms were clean, standard, nothing fancy but very clean. I was on the 19th Floor, the view was wonderful. Would definitely stay there again. Rooms were reasonably priced as well, although we likely got a group rate but even the regular rates that I checked out on line were very good. For a Holiday Inn I expected nothing but an adequate stay, however, this was more than adequate. The bed and pillows were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “one big mistake”
Reviews.Author: emscb
Reviews.Content: Two nights, handicap room, I have stayed at Holiday Inn in Europe and North America over the past number of years and have never seen such accommodations by any chain or private hotel/motel. On arrival and registration the clerk gave us a handicap room, gave the concierge $10.00 for parking my car and baggage to be taken to room, my wife is in a wheelchair and needed quick access. When we entered the room there was a unregistered occupant, the desk clerk dumbfounded gave us another and the staffer with the luggage disappeared leaving me with wheelchair and wife with luggage. The room was dirty by anybodies standard, the rollin shower hand held spray was unworkable, the bed was the worst we have ever encountered on any trip since the sixties, the only thing acceptable was the pillow, the coffee perk was dirty and the following day they didn't clean it or throw out the used paper cups. Holliday Inn I recommend that this inn be closed, renovated and all staff be terminated as your reputation is now in question. This location requires a restart or sale. I can't imagine anyone trying the restaurant - pool or spa

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: swimfast151
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here! Yes it looks great in some of the pictures and they say its been renovated and yes the location looks great but the truth has been reveiled to me at least. We arrived on Sunday May 22nd and as Priority Club members awaited our complimentary upgrade. No luck, I dont think the front desk staff knows what Priority Club is. so we get our room card and once on our floor we quickly note the stains all along the carpets heading to our room, the smell of urine is faint but real. Once in our room the carpet is better but there is no way I'm taking my shoes off, its still gross. A quick inspection of the room finds plastic clothing tags, bottle caps and to top it all off hair in the bathroom around the toilet. GROSS! So, we request a room change! the new room is cleaner but the carpet is still bad and the Front desk service when dealing with the room change was terrible. Don't stay here it is gross!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: bluenoser11111
Reviews.Content: A few points from our trip....after check-in, we had just sat down for a few moments before heading out to explore the downtown area, and a Room Attendant came barging in the room - no knock beforehand! She apologized and said that she thought the room was vacant. That was shocking, as I thought they knocked before entering. Anyways, we headed out for the day. The next morning, we headed to the pool for a swim, and found the pool attendant (I use this term loosely) was sitting by the pool totally focused on his i-phone and texting and with two ear buds in his ears. He never looked up once during our swim. This was his break time I guess!!!!!!!!!!! Meanwhile, the pool was full of kids and he was suppposed to be a lifeguard. WOW. I would had to see the lawsuits that hotel would get if something happened to one of the children. We went back to our room to shower, and noticed we didn't have any towels - and we didn't use any the previous day. So, we called and asked for some, and waited and waited and waited. Finally after about 45 minutes, we got our towels. Then, we headed to the lobby for some assistance at the front desk. We asked for a dinner recommendation in the area. The girl at the front desk was short with us - and literally pointed left and told us to walk that way to find a restaurant. No mention of a name of a restaurant, nothing. We walked and walked and guessed on a restaurant. We found one, but the food was horrible. A special night for us was ruined by the lack of care and attention by the front desk. What would it take for them to give me a lousy minute of their time to provide a simple request - a restaurant that they would recommend. This level of service (or lack thereof) is disgraceful. If you don't like working in the hotel business - quit. We the valued customer are paying not only for the bedroom but for service. That's all part of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic 3 star, nothing special, can do better for same price”
Reviews.Author: JonnyCanuck99
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this Hotel (May 2011). We had 3 rooms, all were very basic, nothing special. They were clean (although there was a used qtip in my garbage can), the bathroom has a small tub/shower with cheap grey ceramic and a sink outside of the bathroom in the room. the bed was nice, the room was relatively large (one of the rooms was particularly larger than the others). The doors are thin and you can hear everything in the hall, one of the rooms happened to be beside noisy 19 year olds on a party and staff didn't do anything about it. Wifi in the lobby was extremely slow. Overall an ok hotel, but for the same price you can get better.

Reviews.Title: “Whose pants were left under the bed?”
Reviews.Author: KohkomJ
Reviews.Content: The room looked dirty. Not only was there garbage on the floor, there waas a pair of pants under the bed and a sock! When I called the desk they said that housekeeping was gone but would I like someone to come remove the garbage. The man who came up acted annoyed and did not help much. When I came back the next night there was still garbage under the other bed! Yuck. Never again will I stay there. My staff's rooms were not clean either.

Reviews.Title: “Odd towel arrangements”
Reviews.Author: gbcue
Reviews.Content: It's an average Holiday Inn in downtown Montreal. The bathroom is split in two places (tub + toilet, and sink). The walls are thin and you can hear other people turn on the shower, flush the toilet, etc. The downstairs levels look modern, but the rooms could use some renovations, the floors especially. The toilets are the industrial kind, with the lever to flush (no tank). The rate seemed reasonable and the elevators are very fast! I ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast and it was cheap (compared to the US) and the bar was pretty good. For some reason, on the first day we checked in, there were no face towels. On the second day, there was one. WTF? We were given two facial/hand soaps and no body soaps (for the shower).

Reviews.Title: “Service is lacking!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bondtravel
Reviews.Content: Lobby will fool you. The rest is nothing to write about. Housekeeping are not friendly wonder why? Ok if your just looking for a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Overall positive, but do your research before you stay.”
Reviews.Author: kerket
Reviews.Content: Service - Very adequate front desk, baggage and okay valet. Met MOD in halls a few times and he always smiled and spoke to us. The staff met our needs. Room - Clean and comfortable room - good size. Updated bed linens. Bathroom ++ small with sink on the outside. Bathroom needed updating. Plumbing is very loud and can hear neighbour's running water/toilet. Sound travels from hallway when door is closed. Location - great location to St. Catherine. Amenities - Valet parking (didn't like that it was forced upon us), bell hop service (had to use if we wanted to use a luggage cart), Required key to access some floors of the hotel - good safety. Elevator was fast but got very busy and often had to wait to get on.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great concierge, great time”
Reviews.Author: lenspring
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for the first time in montreal with my wife and we had booked for the mariott courtyard and found it was closed, so we walked into the holiday inn midtown next door and the concierges on duty whom if i remember were the "alex's" they said ended up helping us through our whole ordeal and gave us a great stay with very helpful restaurants and even got us tickets for a hockey game which was amazing! I would recommend this place over and over again and make sure those concierges are there to get you the impeccable service like we had! The only problem we experienced was the taxi drivers in front understood very little english.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, bar, restaurant. Mediocre rooms. Horrible Valet.”
Reviews.Author: snakesmckenzie
Reviews.Content: Lobby, bar, and restaurant was nice. The rooms are livable, but def no frills. Garage is about $25 per night to park! We stayed for a hockey tournament and no one was told about this charge at any point before or during the stay. Unless you pay upon checkout, you have to pay valet with cash downstairs, which made checkout very chaotic for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: MrJC77
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through the central reservation system of Holiday Inn. Received confirmation emails with the rate for the room and parking. Upon check in I was qutoed another, significantly higher rate for the room and a higher daily parking rate than quoted in the confirmation emails. The rooms were dirty, the beds had long hairs in them though none of my party has long hair, TV remotes were missing/did not work. The bathrooms were quite small. The wall and lamp shade had what appeared to be wine stains on them. Very disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I encounter at a holiday inn, breakfast if you have coupon they will take a long time. No towel and had to wait 1:”
Reviews.Author: e0frantz
Reviews.Content: Worst service I encounter at a holiday inn, breakfast if you have coupon they will take a long time. No towel and had to wait 1:30 to gget them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: truk85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel while touring McGill. The location is great, its a few blocks from campus and a block away from a metro station. The room was clean and we had a great view of the city. The only problem we experienced was a noisy group of kids staying in the hotel because of hockey tournament, but the hotel staff and management were super helpful and friendly and took care of the problem for us. I give the staff an A+

Reviews.Title: “Mid-range hotel in midtown”
Reviews.Author: climate_criminal
Reviews.Content: there may be some stylish rooms on this hotel, but I certainly didn't see them! It is a resolutely mid-range hotel, with big rooms, anonymous service, and dull decor. Nothing much wrong with it - it's clean and quiet and well located - but it's an anonymous place, just a bunch of rooms in a large tower. I got a cheap deal through a block booking, but would look elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “a good home base”
Reviews.Author: travelingsteveo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 of my 20 year old friends who were here to simply go bar hopping through the city. We had a blast. The hotel is in decent shape but nothing to brag about. The staff was helpful. I really like the internet room where there are four computers available to use. I also love the bar they have there. The bartenders there are very friendly and helpfu. Overall it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bring cleaning equipment not luggage”
Reviews.Author: Pdoggy155019
Reviews.Content: They have spent lots of money on the first floor /lobby/ restaurant area, but the rooms are dirty and smelly

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Superb location. Front desk was great and the restaurant has some really good deals and food is OK. In winter when its super cold and you feel lazy to go out, go here and priority club members get 10% off. The bad : -doors that slam and way too much noise -young party people. -the furniture, even on the executive key access floor is awful and worn. Dont touch the sofa chair. -the concierge is awful!! Bad attitude and if you left your bag to pick up later, he will leave you there until forever. He only focus on who can give him big tips. -strange layout of bathroom and quite small. -chair by the desk keeps going down. -remote control should be wiped down in full, looks germsy! The location rocks and if you get it for $100 per night, might be worth it, thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk great! Concierge needs to rent a personality.”
Reviews.Author: SharontFalmouth
Reviews.Content: Emmanuel was courteous and polite at check in. Enrolled me in the priority club and was very professional. We had 3 different concierge people. None of them were friendly or helpful when we asked for restaraunt information, and were nowhere to be found when we wanted to store our luggage. One of the front desk people had to do it for us. Restaurant was very good with huge portions of food. Room was good with a small bath room. Very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Property needs a reno”
Reviews.Author: Lai Yin L
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to enter the room and see that it was outdated and not as clean as it could be. The carpet felt dirty and the wallpaper in the closet had bloodspots all over it. I advised the front desk and it was not cleaned. The room was small, tv is old, I was bitten by something in bed.....surprising that the hotel hasn't been renovated to be ahead of competition as there are two other hotels next to it (don't know their state). For downtown Montreal, it could be better. The reception staff, bell boys and valet staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Jazz Festival - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JustCarol
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Midtown was the perfect place to settle after a day and evening of Jazz Festing - it has a quaint outdoor area with their bar (for people watching) and is just blocks away from the main festival area (easy walking distance). The room was comfortable and roomy (and quiet!) and we could view the fireworks from our window. Not as fancy as some of the other fancy hotels, but it had everything we needed at an affordable price. And, the bonuses that came with a AAA membership (at check-in) were appreciated. Only kudos for this hotel, the staff and the location (within a short distance to two metro stops).

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hotel for Uptown pricing”
Reviews.Author: mumon2r
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a central location. If you are driving it is difficult to get to, traffic is crazy, and the roads aren't always the easiest to navigate. The parking is expensive and mandatory if you are driving so add atleast $20 per night to your stay. The place looks nice inside. Everything is overpriced in the restaurant and ice cream parlour in the lobby. There is a little pizza place that has cheap but good pizza nearby as well as other restaurants nearby that are cheaper and of good quality. Being that it is downtown there are many shady characters outside at night so be careful. It is located close to a great deal of amenities and to La Ronde as well. The pool looks clean and nice but we didn't have time to enjoy it. The staff spoke well in both languages but weren't necessarily the kindest people. Because we booked online (priceline) they gave us a difficult time. They sent us to a smoking room (knowing I had a child and don't smoke) that didn't have any lights and an alarm was going off in the room as well. It was only after great debate and an assurance that I will write an interesting review that they found another room (after stating for ten minutes that there were no other rooms available). So if you are booking via anything other than the hotel expect issues. Lastly, be careful if you are diving a car from outside Quebec the police officers there will pull you over for being English. I would suggest this place for single or younger clients (drinkers) or business clients but not for families or older couples. I would not suggest you stay here if you are driving either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Martoosh
Reviews.Content: Good location, facilities are nice. The bar and restaurant is quite good and very reasonably priced for a hotel. The rooms are basic and we experienced some noise from adjoining rooms but it was the weekend and we had some young people whooping it up a little at times. There are so many great hotels in Montreal that I would prefer to stay in but if you are looking for a great deal this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Comfortable Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: stokelToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown on Labour Day weekend and like most posters, I would agree that the hotel is not a four star hotel. Then again Montreal is not a four star city. Its' great charm is the rough, raw elegance that you see everywhere from the streets full of holes and beautiful aging buildings to its people with the Gallic flawed beauty. Isn't this why we come here? They gave us a room on the top floor. Room 1917 was pleasantly large with a king sized bed, flat screen TV, coffee maker, iron and board, safe, a desk table and wing chair. There is a separate toilet with tub and shower whose ceramic tiles are a dated avocado green and the tub with a patinaed surface. A powder room with a sink is across from the toilet. There is a slat missing from the louvred closet door. The room has a cream and biege theme with cherrywood furniture. There are several table lamps as well as a floor lamp for reading in the comfy wing chair. The TV has the usual cable channels and the required pay for view. Never mind, the WiFi is free and no access code is required, so I'm up and running in several seconds. Sadly the hotel service directory has all the pages missing. The front desk apologize and explain that due to the logo change, it is being re-printed. The top 6 floors are the executive floors and require a key card in the elevator. Each floor has a work room with a very nice coffee machine (the type you put a cup under and it infuses one cup for you), as well as a computer and printer for guest use. If you read the fine print carefully on a door handle card, you notice that a free continental breakfast is offered. I'm not sure if is just on the executive floors. It consists of decent coffee, a slice of toast, a chocolate brioche and a plain croissant. It comes with required condiments. This is a very busy part of Montreal and parking is difficult so I agree with other members that paying for the valet parking is a good idea only now it is almost $25, not $20 as previously posted. You do have in and out priviledges. We booked this hotel through a website that doesn't tell you the name of the hotel until after you have paid. Once I discovered the name and ran it through Trip Advisor, I was concerned that it was not money well spent. Not true, For just over $110 we got a comfortable quiet hotel room in a central location with a great comfortable bed and we could walk to shopping, markets and the old town.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: lilio74
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in this hotel. I am taking the time to write this review during my trip to hopefully keep anyone from going through our same experience. While I will say it is very well situated, there are many other hotel options in this area, so pick another. The carpets are filthy, both in the hallways and in our room. The shower curtain has an absolutely disgusting smell which I have complained about for 3 days now. This morning I was promised they would fix it. They have not; the odor takes over the room if we do not close the bathroom door. One of our beds is completely concave. The bed linens have visible large tears on the sides. The curtains don't close properly and are missing hooks. There is a very loud random noise made by the plumbing, or something behind the walls. The water in the shower shifts between warm to scalding hot, no warning. The bathroom floor has been dirty with foreign hair since we got here. It's still there 3 days later. The A/C thermostat does not have an OFF button, so you must pick, are you cold or hot? No such thing as room temperature here, as told by the maintenance man. I was also told by the front desk that because we booked through hotwire, we were given a room on the lower floors which are run of the house, older rooms. I have travelled much and stayed at many motels, hotels and resorts. There is NO EXCUSE for these conditions, no matter where you book your reservation. Please, do yourself a favor, DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: LEllen8
Reviews.Content: As a Priority Club Member I always try and book a room in the IHG family. I had finally accumulated enough points to use for a family vacation and looked forward to our stay in Montreal and rationalized that using my cache of points for a more comfortable and highly rated hotel made sense. I always trust what I see via the web regarding photos and descriptions on your websites, but in this case these were extremely misleading. The rooms were showing their age and were not cleaned to the level that I have become accustomed to the IHG properties. The plumbing was an issue which I did bring to the attention of the management, but because it was not fixed I could not tell one way or the other whether an attempt was made to correct it or not. During the checkout when asked how my stay was, I relayed my concerns and the only reply was that that the agent would tell her manager. I found this to be a curious reply since upon check in I was given some literature stating that if I couldn't give the hotel an "Excellent" review to let them know first so they could remedy the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs a lot of updating”
Reviews.Author: tvee508
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I stayed at this Holiday Inn. We found the location to be ideal, easy walking distance to the shopping and restaurants on St Catherine St. Also, a short cab ride to Old Montreal. As in previous reviews, the lobby was very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We found the pool and execise room to be a great place to relax. The biggest problem we encountered was the filthy carpets. We stayed on the 5th floor and the carpets were disgusting, both in the hallway and rooms. I hesitated to walk about the rooms in my bare feet. Anothe huge issue for us was the lack of dark drapes. Each morning as the sun arose, our room filled with light making sleeping in impossible. The cleaning staff did tidy up the room, the bedding was clean and fresh. The room was outdated, which we didn't have a problem with, as we were not being charged top rates for the area. For the life of me, I can't figure out why a national hotel chain would allow the hotel to continue to use its name in that condition. All in all, a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: sudanka
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. This time we stayed on one of the executive floors in a corner room. This room had a king-sized bed, sofa-couch, and a great view of Mont-Royal and part of downtown. There were also croissants and muffins put out in the business center in the morning, accessible only to those on the executive floors. Nice touch, along with the coffee/hot chocolate dispensers and internet. My older teenagers much enjoyed the cardio/exercise room and its' hours. These 2 young men had the exercise room to themselves most of the time The pool is a great size and was never crowded. I had the chance to swim some laps. The jacuzzi - only good if you know the other people in it as your feet or other body parts might touch...it's a 4 person jacuzzi I think (or better if for 2). I should add we stayed from a Monday to Friday. The weekends are probably alot busier. Appreciated the use of free internet on the main and 19th floor. The concierges were very helpful and a great asset. They made my stay a better one to be sure. The location was great. Just a 5 minute walk to the metro or underground shopping. We preferred to use the McGill Metro due to there not being a steep incline to go up to the hotel as from the Place des Arts Metro. It was easy to orient ourselves as well as we just had to head upwards, as the hotel is on a slight hill. We took the 747 from the airport, transferred at Berry UQAM to a metro and got off at McGill. You can buy a $7 ticket that gives you unlimited travel on buses and metro for 24 hours from time of purchase, or a $14 ticket that gives you 3 days of unlimited travel as of the date of purchase and till midnight on the 3rd day. One problem I had was that my local calls were free on our floor but I couldn't make phonecalls due to the phones (2 in our room) being blocked and giving me busy signals upon dialing out. The front desk did not look into it further on my first day and assumed I wasn't dialing correctly. This was rectified the next day when I went to the front desk and insisted there was a problem. They then understood the lines were blocked and at that point it was a quick fix. My second problem was that I was unable to lower the heat in our room. The thermostat wasn't functioning and was reading 25 when we so desperately wanted to have it cooler. It had a mind of it's own and gave us a cool room when it wanted. This may have been in part due to the extreme heat/humidity during our stay in Montreal and didn't take away from our enjoyment of our room. I would definitely stay here again but only if I could get a corner suite on the executive floor. Our 2nd stay was much better. I do seem to recall hearing pipes from other rooms when in a middle suite on a lower floor, back in 2006. Not an issue this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some catches.”
Reviews.Author: Gary C
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel via a "bidding" site where you wouldn't know the hotel name until after you've won. It was marked as a 3.5 star but we really think it was more of a 3 star (with reasons to follow). To park at the location, you must use their valet parking. It's all good and stuff minus the convenience of dropping stuff at your car after (prepare to line up if you need to do it during the day time), and the fact that when they pull a Tokyo drift when getting your car to you (We heard tire screeches as they maneuvered the parking lot in our car). It's also $22 after taxes per day. It does have in/out privileges so that's a plus! The luxury look kind of stops at the lobby. We got a limited access floor (you need your key card in elevator to access the floor), and when we got into our room, it was pretty small. We had a 2 double bed room and there were no real desks; just a tall table and 2 sofas. If you need to do work; go back to the lobby. But WiFi was free throughout the hotel :) There's no complimentary breakfast but maybe that's the norm for that location. There is a restaurant downstairs where you can get two eggs, toast, a choice of meat and coffee for only $6.95 + taxes. In terms of cleanliness / service, we asked house cleaning to help us clean the tub because we made a mess, but even after they cleaned it, it still smelled kind of bad. It's obvious that they simply just rinsed it with water and that's it. We even tipped them $10 in advance too... I'm not saying it's their fault that the place was dirty but I'm saying they didn't put up too much effort in cleaning it even when we provided incentives. Summary: Pros: - Great location!!!! - Valet Parking ($) - Free Wifi Cons: - mediocre service - Valet was a little reckless (could had smashed our car since they were turning at those speeds) - small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: skiXXi
Reviews.Content: It's not that I'm used to staying in really nice hotels or anything. I went to montreal for my boyfriend's birthday and wanted to stay somewhere a little nicer, hence I went for a 3.5 star (since there were no 4-star deals at the time). Here is a list of what we experienced at at the Holiday Inn. -extremely small and old bathrooms -drink spilt on wall from previous guest left uncleaned -ran out of towels at the pool so you had to go find your own or use the ones from your shower -remote for tv was broken -AC was barely cooling the room -our room wasn't cleaned until Sat. at 3pm, AFTER we called the front desk -30+ min wait for valet to get car back after checking out As you can see, after all the points listed above, what a disappointment this hotel was. My only point is, this hotel's 3.5 star rating is very deceiving. This hotel would be fine if your just looking for a mediicre hotel 2.5-star hotel with worse-than-average service.

Reviews.Title: “You Must Valet Park”
Reviews.Author: dg3000
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, I was told that unless you speak French, don't even try to park anywhere overnight except their valet which cost $20. Front desk staff was good, valet so-so. Room with two double beds was okay. Breakfast at the restaurant in the lobby was great and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “I had a very brief stay in the Holiday...”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon
Reviews.Content: I had a very brief stay in the Holiday Inn Montreal Midtown for one night whilst visiting friends: I checked in at about 5pm and left at 4.30am for an early flight. The hotel is easy to find and has a bar, coffee shop and general shop on the ground floor. Check in is right at the back of the lobby. The room was dated but comfortable, with an interesting 'urban' view out of the window. As a priority club gold member I was given an upgrade to the executive floor and a voucher for two drinks for the price of one in the bar. I wasn't there long enough to sample all of the hotel's amenities but it worked well for a short stay: the room was comfortable, the staff were helpful and the shower was powerful.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Experience”
Reviews.Author: OtownGrl
Reviews.Content: The only clean thing about this hotel was the lobby! The carpets in the hallways were stained beyond belief and the air smelled of stale cigarette smoke. Our room was filthy, the rug obviously hadn't been vacumed or steam cleaned EVER (candies stuck to the rug, power substance, paper/tags under the bed). The bathroom was THE worst. The corners of the floor were black with dirt, the tiles in the shower were covered with mildew and the grout was cracked/missing. The showerhead was so clogged that only 1/2 of the holes actually allowed water to pass and the sink was across the the hall from the toilet/shower. The airconditioning in the room was barely working which made it impossible to sleep in 37C degree heat (of course they had no fans). This hotel has not been maintained and is incredibly run-down. Instead of spending money on doormen, they should invest in a total overhaul of their hotel and teach staff how to CLEAN! This was hands down, the WORST hotel experience of my life.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T TRUST THE VALET PARKING, THEY CRASHED MY CAR”
Reviews.Author: kellyptcruzer
Reviews.Content: I never write a review on any place that i ever stay at, but i feel so PISSED OFF!!! that they smashed the front of my NISSAN car so here it goes. I checked in on Thursday July 1st 2010 at 2pm, when i got to the hotel a young man greeted us and told us that the hotel offered Valet service, we took our bags out and the young man said he would give us a card that we could present at P2 any time we needed the car. My boyfriend never trust valet parking but we had no choice (there is not much parking spots in that area) ohh and there is a $20 fee each day for parking your car at the hotel that no one tells u about. On Thursday we stayed local and walked around the area so we left the car at the hotel same as on Friday (all the malls are close by as well as the Jazz festival) On Saturday we checked out at 12 noon and drove back to Tronto when we got half way home we needed gas and we stoped for gas and a coffee. My boyfriend walked to the front of the car and noticed that the front of the car was banged up (scratches and the font licenses plat was bent like they hit a poll) We called the hotel asap and spoke to the manager who said to us that there was nothing he could do, we needed to claim it on our car insurance, that their was nothing he could do again and if we wanted we could leave a message with security so we did and at this time saturday 11:50pm we have not heard back. I called again and spoke to the Garage the person who picked up said i could call the parking garage manager and speak to him, i asked the person who answered the phone if the P2 garage has security cameras and he said no, What a f$#@'n JOKE. I am still waiting back to hear from these idiots..... PLEASE BE CAREFUL WHEN U LEAVE YOUR CAR THERE, check it each time clearly you dont even need a license to work as a valet person i guess what bothers me more is that no one said anything, accidents happen but just be honest about it. How would buddy like it if this happend to his car? P.S. Rooms look old and beat up!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there on a week-end if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2408
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn for 4 nights for a business trip. The room was on the "executive floor" and I was told that these could not be accessed by just anyone. The hotel hosted several proms on Friday night with hordes of kids drinking and yelling all night long all through the hotel, executive floors included. Security was completely absent, to the point that one of the kids was stabbed in the lobby. The following morning, the elevators and landings were filthy, with broken beer bottles, spilled beer and wine everywhere. These had not been cleaned by 9:30 am.
